text: Anyone really good with JavaScript willing to try to answer some lay person questions?

elements.text: Anyone really good with JavaScript willing to try to answer some lay person questions?

text: Do you know if its possible to use Greesemonkey to sniff/snoop on a web pages HTTP post requests? Have a weird scenario where a payload in the network traffic(available via a web browser) is neat/useful. But, no good means to get at it via automation.

elements.text: Do you know if its possible to use Greesemonkey to sniff/snoop on a web pages HTTP post requests? Have a weird scenario where a payload in the network traffic(available via a web browser) is neat/useful. But, no good means to get at it via automation.

text:
Do you need to do it in JS/Greesemonkey?
Cos if you can setup a proxy in the browser, you can definitely do that.
We used ITKO LISA for some things  in testing at my old job (a long time ago) and it worked on that principle

elements.text:
Do you need to do it in JS/Greesemonkey?
Cos if you can setup a proxy in the browser, you can definitely do that.

text: Doesn't have to be JS. I would like to avoid running something like tshark and packet sniffing but maybe thats an alternative. I'll have to look at ITKO LISA.

elements.text: Doesn't have to be JS. I would like to avoid running something like tshark and packet sniffing but maybe thats an alternative. I'll have to look at ITKO LISA.

text:
I think it's incredibly expensive.
I don't know that ITKO even exists anymore.
And it was a huge thing, it would be nuking a molehill.

elements.text:

text: Postman and Burp Suite should be able to do it, too

elements.text: Postman and Burp Suite should be able to do it, too

text: okay so postman has a chrome plugin thats exactly what I want. Except I want it as an API :stuck_out_tongue:.

elements.text: okay so postman has a chrome plugin thats exactly what I want. Except I want it as an API

text: One scheme I came up with is... Inside a docker, run tshark, then open up a CLI web browser to the page of interest, close the browser, close tshark. Parse the logs.
